intro: Chaetocladus altissima, commonly known as the tall spike moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Hypnaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. The plant produces dense clusters of small, spore-bearing capsules at the tips of its shoots. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its structure and reproductive features make it an important component of woodland ecosystems.
